column2: officially the Municipality of Mauban (Tagalog: Bayan ng Mauban)
column3: is a 1st class municipality in the province of Quezon
column6: 819 people.It lies 157 km (98 mi) southeast from Manila and some 52 km (32 mi) from Lucena City
column7: capital of Quezon province. From Metro Manila Passing Through Rizal Province and Laguna (province) East Via Manila East Road

column1: Mauban is politically subdivided into 40 barangays.

column3: a 440 megawatt coal power plant was constructed to bring consistent power to the area. It was the first privately built
column5: and operated power generating facility in the Philippines.

column2: the Department of Education lists 35 public schools in Mauban; 29 are Elementary schools
column3: while the remaining 6 are High Schools. The Elementary schools are divided into two districts: Mauban North and Mauban South.

column1: Cagsiay III-Cagsiay I National High School Extension
Dr. Maria D. Pastrana National High School (Mauban Science-Oriented High School)
Manuel S. Enverga Memorial School of Arts and Trades (Quezon National School of Arts & Trades)Mauban also has two private schools
column2: Central Quezon Academy in Barangay Mabato and Mother Perpetua Parochial School in Barangay Lual Poblacion. It also has one college
